metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19073 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Memory leaks in drivers/net/wireless/ath/ath9k/htc_hst.c in the Linuxkernel through 5.3.11 allow attackers to cause a denial of service (memoryconsumption) by triggering wait_for_completion_timeout() failures. Thisaffects the htc_config_pipe_credits() function, the htc_setup_complete()function, and the htc_connect_service() function, aka CID-853acf7caf10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19073` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1080.87
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1114.127
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1083.87~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1096.106~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1084.95~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1054.58~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1139-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1139.148
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1143-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1143.152
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-190.220').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1080.87').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1114.127').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1083.87~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1096.106~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1084.95~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1054.58~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.148').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1143.152').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
